newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil October trade gap seen at $900 mln - paper.
newsitem.headline: Brazil October trade gap seen at $900 mln - paper.

text.p: The government is expected to unveil a $900 million trade gap for October, the 15th deficit in 28 months of Real economic stabilization plan, a financial newspaper said.
This outlook, which would bring the trade gap for the first 10 months of 1996 to $2.5 billion, stirred the financial markets, Gazeta Mercantil said.
Gazeta said the Finance Ministry was not anticipating a change in the trade balance's trend until mid-1997 when measures designed to stimulate exports should take effect.
Last week, the government revealed disappointing exports of $4.188 billion in October, up from $4.115 billion in September but down from October 1995's $4.405 billion.
-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151
